block.p: The growing trade in people transported by criminal gangs from their impoverished lands to Europe produced a grisly new statistic when the bodies of 58 refugees from Fujian province in China were discovered in the overheated and airless container of a Dutch truck when it came ashore from a channel ferry at Dover, in southern England. Two survivors were recovering in a Canterbury hospital. The British police charged the driver, Perry Wacker, 32, of Rotterdam, with 58 counts of manslaughter.
